objtitle.title: *Sir Jeffery Chaucer and the Nine and Twenty Pilgrims on Their Journey to Canterbury*

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with pen and ink outlining

provenance.name: Glasgow District Council, Pollok House
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; sold from the collection of Thomas Butts, Jr., Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 93, with Blake's engraving of the design and possibly two books, one an "explanation by the artist," possibly copy O of Blake's 1809 *Descriptive Catalogue* (£10.10s. to William Stirling-Maxwell); by inheritance in 1878 to John Stirling-Maxwell; Mrs. A. Maxwell Macdonald; given by Macdonald in 1967 to the Corporation of Glasgow (now Glasgow District Council) and housed at Pollok House, Glasgow.

desc.objtitle:
Sir Jeffery Chaucer and the Nine and Twenty Pilgrims on Their Journey to Canterbury,
Object 1 (Butlin 653)

objnote.p: Blake included this tempera painting in his 1809 exhibition, number III in the accompanying *Descriptive Catalogue*, and in the 1812 exhibition of the Associated Painters in Water Colors, number 254 in the accompanying *Catalogue of the Fifth Annual Exhibition by the Associated Painters in Water Colors*. Blake's engraving of the design is dated 8 Oct. 1810 in the imprint.
